titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York State National Guard, 51st Cavalry Brigade payroll record 1977.593
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T10:34-0500

did.unittitle: New York State National Guard, 51st Cavalry Brigade payroll record

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: New York (State). National Guard. Cavalry Brigade, 51st.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York State National Guard 51st Cavalry Brigade was organized circa 1920 and held its headquarters at an armory on Staten Island formerly known as Manor Farm.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York State National Guard, 51st Cavalry Brigade payroll record, 1977.593, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Payroll record of the New York State National Guard 51st Cavalry Brigade for the period August 1 to September 30, 1940.

controlaccess.corpname: New York (State). National Guard. Cavalry Brigade, 51st.
